@DrTedros @ECDC_EU @SherBDeuba @narendramodi @ACTAccelerator @POTUS "It will take all countries, regardless of income level, to commit to steps that can bring the #COVID19 pandemic to an end, end inequities, save lives, prevent suffering, and help get economies back on track"-@DrTedros https://t.co/F0wxFtpvHU

@DrTedros @ECDC_EU @SherBDeuba @narendramodi @ACTAccelerator "I‚Äôm pleased that next month, üá∫üá∏ @POTUS will hold a Global #COVID19 Summit with world leaders, to maintain the high-level attention that this ongoing pandemic deserves"-@DrTedros https://t.co/9MdkJ0dLOs

@DrTedros @ECDC_EU @SherBDeuba @narendramodi @ACTAccelerator "In October last year, the @ACTAccelerator launched a new Strategic Plan and Budget ‚Äì and yet halfway through its current budget cycle, just over 10% has been funded. The #COVID19 pandemic is not over, and neither is the work of the ACT Accelerator"-@DrTedros

@DrTedros @ECDC_EU @SherBDeuba @narendramodi @ACTAccelerator "Together, we've:
-enabled 40 countries to begin #COVID19 vaccination campaigns
-helped to build the sequencing capacity in Southern Africa
-negotiated unprecedented deals with the üåç‚Äôs largest oxygen suppliers to increase access in 120+ low- & middle-income countries"-@DrTedros

@DrTedros @ECDC_EU @SherBDeuba @narendramodi "This is compounded by a lack of price transparency in bilateral deals made by the producer. The persistent global gaps in access to tests, üíâ & treatments highlight why the @ACTAccelerator remains crucial to the global response to #COVID19"-@DrTedros 
https://t.co/pVHUwwyAxN

@DrTedros @ECDC_EU @SherBDeuba @narendramodi "And it‚Äôs not just vaccines. On Friday, WHO recommended the antiviral combination nirmatrelvir and ritonavir, also known as Paxlovid, for patients with mild or moderate #COVID19 that are at high-risk of hospitalisation"-@DrTedros 
https://t.co/ZmbQMbI9Qo

@DrTedros @ECDC_EU @SherBDeuba @narendramodi "Closing this gap remains essential to ending the #COVID19 pandemic as a global health emergency"-@DrTedros #VaccinEquity 
https://t.co/Rdpil3UDaL

@DrTedros @ECDC_EU @SherBDeuba @narendramodi "This is the level of vaccination we need to see in all countries. Almost 60% of the world‚Äôs population has now completed a primary course of #COVID19 vaccination, but only 11% of the population of low-income countries"-@DrTedros https://t.co/NMORZAnOeV

@DrTedros @ECDC_EU @SherBDeuba @narendramodi "Both #Nepal and #India are getting closer to vaccinating 70% of their populations against #COVID19 by the middle of the year, and they‚Äôre also rolling out boosters to the most vulnerable. As a result, both countries are now seeing a decoupling between cases and deaths"-@DrTedros

@DrTedros @ECDC_EU @SherBDeuba "But around the world, the #COVID19 pandemic has caused severe disruptions to routine immunization programmes, putting millions of children‚Äôs lives at risk, and opening the door to fresh outbreaks of measles and polio"-@DrTedros #LongLifeForAll https://t.co/cDVJWF6zW1

@DrTedros @ECDC_EU @SherBDeuba "It was a great reminder of the power of vaccines to save lives ‚Äì from #COVID19 and many other deadly diseases, including measles, meningitis, Ebola, polio and more"-@DrTedros https://t.co/DvrdmwTFg3

@DrTedros @ECDC_EU @SherBDeuba "I saw how, with WHO support, #Nepal has established genome sequencing in its National Public Health Laboratory, which will be key to identifying potential variants of the #COVID19 virus, as well as future pathogens"-@DrTedros https://t.co/t1H7Fy4rul
@DrTedros @ECDC_EU "Last week I had the honour to visit #Nepal, and to discuss the impact of the pandemic with Prime Minister @SherBDeuba and President Bhandari"-@DrTedros https://t.co/LdoZqtTX8X

@DrTedros @ECDC_EU "The threat of a dangerous new [#COVID19] variant remains very real ‚Äì and although deaths are declining, we still don‚Äôt understand the long-term consequences of infection in those who survive"-@DrTedros

@DrTedros @ECDC_EU "But this [#COVID19] virus won‚Äôt go away just because countries stop looking for it. It‚Äôs still spreading, it‚Äôs still changing, and it‚Äôs still killing"-@DrTedros https://t.co/QeM8Mmhdlo

@DrTedros @ECDC_EU "Globally, reported #COVID19 cases and deaths continue to decline, which is very encouraging. Last week, just over 15,000 deaths were reported to WHO ‚Äì the lowest weekly total since March 2020"-@DrTedros
